=======

Made up of intimate, revelatory footage of the singular author and poet
filmed over the course of five years, Howard Brooknerâ€™s 1983 documentary
about William S. Burroughs was for decades mainly the stuff of legend; that
changed when Aaron Brookner, the late directorâ€™s nephew, discovered a
print of it in 2011 and spearheaded a restoration. Now viewers can enjoy
the invigorating candidness of Burroughs: The Movie, a one-of-a-kind
nonfiction portrait that features on-screen appearances by fellow artists
of Burroughsâ€™s including Allen Ginsberg, Herbert Huncke, Patti Smith, and
Terry Southern.
